column2: Yellowbloods make for good breeding stock.
Rome fell due to misuse of magic.
Lucius Sergius founded the Second Republic, Lucius Septimius founded the Third.
Lime and Jadebloods make for poor breeding stock.
Flavius Claudius attempted to seize Imperial authority in Rome but lost the city to barbarians.
Flavius Julius never really loved his brothers that much.
Nobody believed Hroderic about Rome.
Xosrau was a great lover of honeyed goods.
The death of Xosrau was a very convenient one.
Alexandros is the son of a Syrian doux.
Alexandros' brother, Argyros, wanted to name his son Basileus.
Alexandros' mother is rumoured to have loved juggling.
Nobody dares to call the Imperator a bastard.
Egypt used to be a province of Rome before 642.
Rumours circulate about the true nature of the Imperator's mother.
Nobody remembers the half-blind anymore.
Imperatrix Theodora ruled for twenty-three years under the pretense of regency.
Flavius Heraclius was hailed as a diplomatic genius back in his day.
Abu Bakr could never have defeated both empires at once.
Maculists are one of the two main branches of Christianity, claiming Jesus was the son of man.
Immaculists are one of the two main branches of Christiantiy, claiming Jesus was the son of God.
Abu 'l-Abbas dreamt he was the prophet. He was found full of holes.
The Langobards had converted long before the Maculists came.
Durocortorum is the seat of Merovingian Gaul.
Sabellianism thrives in the exarchate of Carchedon.
The Vandals had long since settled on the Mediterranean shore.
Hilderic isn't well-loved, and not for petty reasons either.
The Saxons in Germania and Britania are one people with two faiths.
One doesn't just bring his pet along for a visit to a Gaulish court.
The Caliph considers it his holy mission to convert men, by either word or sword.
